recipe_name: Pan-fried bacon-wrapped chicken breast with cheesy butternut squash mash
author: Gino D'Acampo
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. For the chicken, make an incision to the chicken breast lengthways to create a pocket.  Place the Stilton into the pocket then wrap the breast with the bacon rashers. Rub the bacon-wrapped breast with the olive oil and season both sides with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat an ovenproof frying pan over a high heat. Add the bacon-wrapped chicken and pan fry for one minute on each side until browned. Transfer to the oven and roast for 12-15 minutes, or until the chicken is completely cooked through. To make the mash, mash the cooked butternut squash using a potato masher or a ricer. Add the cream and Stilton, mix together well and season, to taste, with salt and freshly ground black pepper. To serve, place the mashed butternut squash in the middle of a large warmed plate and place the chicken on top.
ingredients: 150g/5½oz chicken breast,  25g/1oz Stilton,  2 slices smoked back bacon,  1 tbsp olive oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  ½ butternut squash, peeled, seeds removed, chopped, boiled until soft and drained,  50g/1¾oz Stilton,  50ml/2fl oz double cream,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
